text: the guitars we make and we've made for
70 years have been second to none in
quality but a guitar just shipped is a
piece of wood and metal and it takes an
artist it takes a musician to really
make it do something and so the more
that we can get guitars to be in the
hands of people that use them the longer
they use them the more they play the
more they play for other people the more
guitars on stage and the more music made
with these things whether they've been
made 70 years ago or yesterday the
better it is for us and the better it is
ultimately for everybody we just
released spend our songs which is
available on mobile it allow you to
learn potentially millions of songs
using your streaming service and you can
get lyrics as well our goal with
building our operations infrastructure
was to build it how you would build a
product so the end users of that
infrastructure are the developers and
the api's are the contracts with the
developers so my operations and devops
team is really really small and our
uptime is really really good we automate
everything we can we make it linearly
scalable and we automate the deployments
we automate the management of the
servers to make sure that we can over
leverage a small team but to provide a
lot of flexibility for the developers so
if you look at how we deploy servers we
can deploy servers for one person as
easily as for a billion people because
of the way that we've built our entire
pipeline so we really engineered our
infrastructure using lambda and
serverless to not get paged to not have
to worry about downtime to not have to
worry about uptime to just not have to
worry we go back 10 years
I was at a record label and we hosted
all of our stuff at a at a data center
we're actually doing serial numbers of
the hardware ozone we had to start
thinking about new product innovations
and new ways of building things at the
hardware level and start thinking about
drives ram and processors and network
infrastructure when we're at fender you
know we don't think about that we think
about stuff from the product level
what's the product that people are
asking for what's the best way to
iterate this what's the best way to grow
our business and to be thinking about
growing a business solving needs for
customers building products shipping
products and really innovating in the
space without having to think about
hardware has been
the most freeing thing in terms of what
we've done we've gone in four years from
me and a conference table to a team of
you know almost a hundred people with
nine products basically in the market
and been able to do that with not a lot
of overgrowth in terms of having to
support hardware infrastructure you want
to be focused on making a good product
for customers to purchase and for
customers in general and not having the
servers the operations the API calls the
database stack be part of the product
thinking I want that taken for granted
